meanings.definition: A hormone that stimulates the secretion of gastric acid in the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how gastrin helps the stomach make acid.
meanings.sent2: After eating, the body releases gastrin to aid in digestion.
meanings.sent3: Gastrin must be the stomach's favorite hormone, always making it more acidic!
meanings.sent4: Her love for spicy food was like gastrin, increasing the heat in her stomach.
meanings.sent5: The image of gastrin as a little acid booster stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A peptide hormone that regulates the production of gastric acid in the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied how gastrin controls the stomach's acid levels.
meanings.sent2: Too much gastrin can lead to excessive acid in the stomach.
meanings.sent3: The gastrin hormone seemed like a strict supervisor of stomach acid.
meanings.sent4: His anger was like gastrin, stirring up trouble in the stomach of the group.
meanings.sent5: The role of gastrin as a regulator of stomach acid was crystal clear to the students.
